alert.note: Alert for Coryell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 6:41AM CDT until October 27 at 2:51AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Coryell and Lampasas counties in Central Texas * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Copperas Cove, Gatesville, Lampasas, McGregor, Fort Cavazos, Kempner, Evant, Fort Gates, Belton Lake, Mother Neff State Park, Colorado Bend State Park, Lometa, Oglesby, South Mountain, Whitson, Osage, Arnett, Harbin, Hurst Springs and Pidcoke.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
